title-group.article-title: Study on the generation of spiral bevel gears with spherical involute tooth profile by the tracing line

abstract.p: In this article, a new gear generating method for the spiral bevel gear with spherical involutes tooth curves was proposed. It was analysed that the tooth flank with cone-spiral involute surface could be formed by the space trajectory of a straight line. The straight line was named as a tracing line. In the method, three motions were demanded; those were the rotary motion of the workpiece, the rectilinear motion of the end of the tracing line along the dedendum, and the rotary motion of the tracing line in the plane. The motion equations were derived. The plate milling cutter with face cutting edges could be used to machine the spiral bevel gears and the chord line of the face circle worked as the tracing line. By the method, the spiral bevel gears without principle errors whose tooth flanks are exact spherical involute curves that could be achieved.

sec.title: 1 INTRODUCTION
sec.p: Spiral bevel gears are basic components in the transmission of rotation and torque between intersected axes. They are widely used in the industry and transmissions of cars, helicopters, etc., for their features of high carrying capacity, big overlap coefficient, high stability, and low noise and vibration [1–4]. Previous studies on spiral bevel gears have been mainly concerned with the design and the error analysis of gears whose tooth profile are curves [1–10]. The manufacturing process of spiral bevel gears is very difficult since the tooth surface geometry of such gears is quite complex and sensitive to machining-tool settings [11, 12]. For the spiral bevel gear, when the curve of tooth profile changes into a straight line, it becomes the skew bevel gear. Based on the engagement theory, the spiral bevel gears which have different tooth profiles are interchangeable, no matter the tooth profiles are curves or straight lines [13]. In the classical machining method for spiral bevel gear, the cutters are approximate to simplify the tool-making process and the cutting movements; the principle errors exist in those gears [14]. By the principle discussed in this article, gears which have spherical involute tooth profiles and without principle error in theory can be achieved. The machining of the spiral bevel gears is easily realized, especially, the cutting process is highly efficient. In the machine, three motions are demanded to realize the cutting process, they are the rotary motion of the workpiece, the rectilinear motion of the end of the tracing line along the dedendum, and the rotary motion of the tracing line in the plane [13–16].

sec.title: 2 THE TOOTH FLANK GENERATING PRINCIPLE OF SPIRAL BEVEL GEARS WITH SPHERICAL INVOLUTE CURVE PROFILE
sec.p:
The tooth profile of bevel gears is a spherical involute, because the distances between certain points on the tooth and the pitch cone peak are invariable during the meshing. A pair of conjugate tooth profiles which are spherical involute curve can mesh correctly, as shown in Fig. 1, the instantaneous transmission ratio is invariable. Fig. 1
The meshing principle drawing of bevel gears

In Fig. 2, the axis of the base cone is OO1 and its cone angle is δb. The circular plane Q is tangent with the base cone. In the plane Q, the oblique line ML is tangent with a circle whose radius is R0, and named as the tangent circle of the tooth trace. At the beginning, the plane Q is tangent with the base cone at the line OB, and the end point L of the line ML coincides with B. When the base cone and the plane Q roll together without slip around the centre point O, line ML will generate the cone-spiral involute surface ∑ and the base cone and ∑ intersect at line BB1. The intersection of ∑ and the sphere whose centre is O should be spherical involute. The tooth flank is surrounded by the four intersections of ∑ and the face cone, the root cone, the large end plane, and the small end plane. Hence, the space trajectory of the straight line can form the tooth flank with cone-spiral involute surface and the tooth profile is spherical involute. The oblique line ML, which can form the tooth profile, is named as the tracing line. Fig. 2
The gear profile generating principle of spiral bevel gears by the tracing line

According to the above-mentioned principle, a pair of conjugate cone-spiral involute surfaces can be formed on the base cones, respectively. Plane Q is the common tangent plane of the pair of conjugate meshing gears; it is the meshing plane during the transmission process, and the contract line is the tracing line.

The cone-spiral involute surface ∑ is a developable ruled surface, which can realize the conjugate meshing. According to the principle of the third curved surface, etc., the Olivier method, any straight line generator (ML) on a curved surface has a tangent plane T, the plane T keeps vertically with the tangent plane Q forever; the straight line ML is the generator of a base cone and the plane Q the tangent plane of the base cone. The cone-spiral involute surface is convexity buckling which always lies on one side of the plane T. Because ML lies in the plane T, and during machining process, the plane T is the cutting tool plane, which can avoid the interference.

sec.title: 3 THE PRINCIPLE OF THE GEAR GENERATION BY TRACING LINE
sec.p: As shown in Fig. 2, if the line ML is the cutting edge and the kinematic relation meet equation (1), the flank of the spiral bevel gear could be machined. The new method is named as a gear generating method by tracing line. To achieve the gear flank which is a part of the cone-spiral involute surface, the real tracing line is the cutting edge of the cutter during the machining; the end of the real tracing line should cut out from the tooth root to avoid the overcut and the interference, and the velocities of the tracing line and the gear workpiece should be appropriate.

As shown in Fig. 3, the gear is tapered tooth, the plane Q and the base cone are tangent at OJ, the intersection lines of the plane Q and the face cone are OA and OB, and the intersection lines of the plane Q and the root cone are OK and OI; the intersection lines form two symmetrical cutting zones which individually belong to two tooth flanks. The angles between OI and OJ, OK and OJ are the adjusting angle of cutting zone ψ. The angles between OK and OB, OI and OA are the cutting zone angle μ. Fig. 3

In Fig. 4, the line ML in Q is tangent with the tangent circle of the tooth trace, when the base cone and the plane Q roll together without slip, ML will pass the right cutting zone with the rotation of Q and cut the right face of the right-hand gear. The tracing line WV is a part of ML. At the position of M1L1, the machining of the addendum of the small end begins, then, passes through the position of M2L2, then, the tooth root of the large end will be machined. The cutting processing is finished when the end of the tracing line reaches the point K. To achieve exact tooth depth and avoid overcutting, the end point W of the tracing line must be located on the line OK throughout.

By the above analysis, it can be known that the new machining method is based on the tracing line; the motion relations are formed by two parts: one is the revolution of the workpiece and the other is the movement of tracing line in the plane Q (plane xy). By the above analysis, it can be known that if the rotational velocity of the workpiece is ω1 and the movement of the tracing line in xz plane matches equations (8) and (9), equation (1) should be agreed; in other words, the equations (1) and (5) are the motion equations for cutting the right flank of the gear. In the same way, when the tracing line WV passes through the left cutting zone, the left flank of the bevel gear can be machined; the motion direction is inverse of the machining the right flank. The left-hand spiral bevel gear can also be formed.

sec.title: 5 THE MILLING PRINCIPLE OF THE SPIRAL BEVEL GEAR
sec.p: According to the above-mentioned description, it can be understood that if the relative location and the movement of the cutting tool and the workpiece meet Figs 2 to 4 and equations (1), (5), and (23), the tooth of the spiral bevel gear can be machined. In the cutting process, three motions are demanded to form the tooth flank: the rotary motion of the workpiece, whose angular velocity is ω1; the rectilinear motion of the end of the tracing line along the dedendum; and the rotary motion of the tracing line around its end point.

Disc milling cutters or plane milling cutters are usually used to manufacture the curved surface. If the disc milling cutter or the plane milling cutter has face cutting edges, and the chord lines of the face circle are worked as the tracing line, the gear tooth can be manufactured in theory.

As shown in Fig. 6, the radius of the disc milling cutter is ρ. There are cutting edges on the end face, then there are several cutting points on the chord line WV. If the disc rotates at a high speed ω3, and the centre is O4, as shown in Figs 6 and 7, those cutting points would constitute a generating line WV. At the same time, the chord lines working as the tracing line move along the line OK and rotate around the point W; the right face of the spiral bevel gear can be machined. In Figs 6 and 7, the point W is in coincidence with O3 and ω3=ωW=dαdt=ω. (The rotation direction is shown in those figures.) O3 is the gyration centre of the milling cutter base. Fig. 6
The schematic diagram for the chord edges of the disc milling cutter machining the tooth face Fig. 7
The cutting principle of one side tooth face of right-hand gears

By the method, the gear milling is made simple, highly efficient, and if the milling cutter is substituted by the abrasion wheel, the grinding of the tooth flank can be realized. The process of cutting right flank of right-hand gears is shown in Figs 6 and 7. According to the both end face cutting edges being used or not, the different handedness gears or different flanks of gears can be machined by adjusting the following parameters: the angle of the milling cutter, the orientation of ω and ω1, the initial position of the tracing line, and the movement equations of the tracing line. In Fig. 8, the mounting angle and the rotation orientation of the milling cutter are shown when the tracing lines lying on one end face cutting edge are used to cut the left side flank of the right-hand gear. Fig. 8
The mounting and rotation direction of the milling cutter when machining the other side tooth face of right-hand gears

When gears with different spiral angles or different moduli are machined, the parameter R0 can be changed. During the process of choosing cutter, it should be noticed that the thickness of the milling cutter could not make the other flank overcut. The overcut of the dedendum will occur because of the distance τ between the chord and the peak of the circle shown in Figs 6 and 8. The overcut depth is related to the spiral angle; the maximum depth of overcut for machining spur gear is less than τ. Wherein τ can be expressed by equation (24) (24)

It can be seen from equation (24) that the overcut can be decreased by increasing the radius of the milling cutter. According the clearance existing on any gear, the tooth flank can be machined correctly when τ is less than the gear clearance. In the milling process, the tooth depth and the gear meshing can be met by adjusting ψ and changing the demotion of the root cone.

In the milling method, it should be noticed that the interference could not occur when the end face of the milling cutter lies on the plane T (shown in Fig. 7) which is vertical with plane Q. If the tapered milling cutter has a circle end face with cutting edges and the interference does not occur during the cutting process, it can be used to improve the rigidity of the cutting system. In the milling gear method, when the length of the tracing line is shorter, the tracing line can be looked upon as a point. Then, a line on the tooth flank is machined during each motion process of the above-mentioned method. Marching an appropriate kinematic relation, the spiral bevel gear with spherical involutes and any kind of tooth trace can be manufactured by the envelope principle.
In the milling method, the metal is removed by the high speed rotation of the cutter. The method is fit for the incremental index and one flank cutting.

sec.title: 6 THE ADJUSTMENT AND FINALIZATION OF THE TRACING LINE
sec.p: The implementation of the above-mentioned method is based on that the tracing line keeps plane motion inthe plane xz, and its motion agrees with equations (1) and (5). It is needed that the end of the tracing line lies on the gyration centre of the milling cutter base. Hence, the position of the cutter should be adjusted when the cutter is replaced. The position of the tracing line along the normal direction of the plane Q can be adjusted by changing the relative position of the workpiece and the plane Q. However, when the position of the tracing line in plane xz (plane Q, etc.) is changed, the cutter should be mounted again to keepthe gyration centre being in coincidence with the end point of the tracing line. The machine adjustment is a trouble for the above adjustment work. In response to the motion principle of a rigid body, by changing the position of the gyration centre and the motion equations of the tracing line, the cutter position should not be adjusted after changing the cutter.

As shown in Figs 9 and 10, any point O3 is attached to the line WV, defined as |WO3|=r, the angle between WO3 and WV is λ. If at the initial position of the tracing line, ∠MOW=ωt0, at time t, the point W reaches the point W1 ' and the point O3 the point O3 '; motions are following the patterns expressed in equations (5) and (23). Then, the increment motions are needed to make the point W1 ' reach point W1. On account of the geometrical relationship shown in Fig. 9, the compensating displacement for cutting the right flank of the right-hand gear can be achieved. Fig. 9

The last position of tracing line when its motion agrees with equations (25) is same as equations (5). In equations (25), when r = 0, the point O3 is in coincidence with the point W. The angular velocity of the line WV rotating around the point O3 is still ω.

The relative positions of the milling cutter and thegyration centre are definite after the cutter is mounted. First, make the end of the tracing line locate at the correct position by the motion in the plane xz (shown in Fig. 6), then confirm the position of the gyration centre in the coordinate xz, and achieve the value of r and λ. The initial position of the line WV can be confirmed by R0, Li, and ψ; the length of the line WV can be confirmed by μ. The value of ω can be achieved by equation (1) after ω1 is known. The tooth flank can be machined by the motion expressed by equations (25).
In a similar manner, the displacement of the compensating motion can be obtained when the other hand gear or flank was machined.

sec.title: 8 THE SIMULATION RESULT
sec.p:
Based on the above theoretical analysis and equations, the kinematic simulation is proceeded, the software is CATIA. The simulation results are shown in Fig. 12 and the parameters in Table 1. The circulation process of cutting the right side flank of the right-hand big gear is as follows: first of all, the milling cutter cuts from the small end to the large end; second, the workpiece indexes to the right side flank of the next tooth; then, the cutter cuts from the large end to the small end; at last, the workpiece indexes to the right side flank of the third tooth and the cutter cuts from the small end to the large end. list-item.p: In this article, the space trajectory of a straight line was analysed, which can form the tooth flank with cone-spiral involute surface and the tooth profile is spherical involute. The straight line is named as tracing line.
2A new theory form of the flank of the spiral bevel gear with spherical involutes tooth profile by tracing line is discussed. The motion equations of the tracing line are achieved.

In the new method, to achieve the spiral bevel gear with spherical involute tooth profiles, three moments are needed, which are the rotary motion of the workpiece (the angular velocity is ω1 ), the rotary motion of the tracing line in the plane Q (the angular velocity is ω and ω = ω1 sin δb), and the rectilinear motion of the end of the tracing line along the dedendum.

Disc, plane, or tapered milling cutters can be used in the method for machining spiral bevel gears. If the disc milling cutter or the plane milling cutter has face cutting edges, the chord lines of the face circle are the tracing line, the gear tooth can be manufactured in theory when movements of the workpiece and the tracing line are right. When parameters are suitable, the tooth flank can be formed by a single cutting pass. For the tooth flank of spiral bevel gears, high efficiency and precision machining should be realized without complex tools and special tools by the method. The three-dimensional model of the spiral bevel gear pair is achieved by the kinematics simulation based on CATIA software.

The new machine method of the spiral bevel gear is without error in theory, simple, and highly efficient. If the milling cutter is substituted by the abrasion wheel, the tooth flank grinding can be realized.
In the milling gear method, any kind of tooth trace can be manufactured by the envelope principle.
